Name: Requiring the DOE to provide district-level data regarding compliance rates for students’ individualized education programs.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to provide district-level data regarding compliance rates for students’ individualized education programs
Summary: This bill would amend Local Law 27 of 2015 to require the Department of Education to disaggregate by school its report on individualized education program compliance rates and provide the number and percentage of students, by school, that are receiving the full services they are entitled to.

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Subdivision a of section 21-955 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by introduction number 1406-A for the year 2019, is amended by adding a new definition of \ldblquote service recommendation\rdblquote  in alphabetical order to read as follows:\par
\ul Service recommendation. The term \ldblquote service recommendation\rdblquote  means the type of services outlined in an individualized education program, including consultant teacher services, resource room programs, integrated co-teaching services, and special class as such terms are defined in section 200.1 of title 8 of the New York codes, rules and regulations.\par
\ulnone\'a7 2. Paragraphs 12 and 13 of subdivision b of section 21-955 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 27 for the year 2015, are amended to read as follows:\par
12. the number and percentage of students\ul , disaggregated by service recommendation, school and community school district,\ulnone  who were receiving special education services:\par
(i) in full compliance with their IEPs by the end of the academic period; and\par
(ii) in partial compliance with their IEPs by the end of the academic period;\par
13. the number and percentage of students\ul , disaggregated by service recommendation,  school and community school district,\ulnone  who, by the end of the academic period, were receiving in full the services enumerated in subparagraphs [(i)] \ul (a)\ulnone  through [(viii)] \ul (h)\ulnone  of this paragraph as recommended on their IEPs, the number and percentage of students who as of the end of the academic period were receiving in part such services, and the number and percentage of students who were awaiting the provision of such services:\par
[(i) monolingual] \ul (a) Monolingual\ulnone  speech therapy;\par
[(ii) bilingual] \ul (b) Bilingual\ulnone  speech therapy;\par
[(iii) monolingual] \ul (c) Monolingual\ulnone  counseling;\par
[(iv) bilingual] \ul (d) Bilingual\ulnone  counseling;\par
[(v) occupational] \ul (e) Occupational\ulnone  therapy;\par
[(vi) physical] \ul (f) Physical\ulnone  therapy;\par
[(vii) hearing] \ul (g) Hearing\ulnone  education services; [and]\par
[(viii) vision] \ul (h) Vision\ulnone  education services;\par
\'a7 3. Paragraph 14 of subdivision b of section 21-955 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as added by local law number 27 for the year 2015, is renumbered as paragraph 15, and a new paragraph 14 is added to such subdivision to read as follows:\par
\ul 14. The number and percentage of students, disaggregated by service recommendation, school and community school district, who have a behavioral intervention plan; and\par
\ulnone\'a7 4. Subdivision d of section 21-955 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 89 for the year 2018, is amended to read as follows:\par
d. [\cf1 No information that is otherwise required to be reported pursuant to this section shall be reported in a manner that would violate any applicable provision of federal, state or local law relating to the privacy of student information or that would interfere with law enforcement investigations or otherwise conflict with the interests of law enforcement. If a category contains between 1 and 5 students, or allows another category to be narrowed to between 1 and 5 students, the number shall be replaced with a symbol.] \cf0\ul The report required by subdivision b of this section shall also include, to the extent practicable, a narrative description of the provision of special education services for students enrolled in district 79 schools and programs.\ulnone\par
\pard\ltrpar\qj\'a7 5. This local law takes effect on the same date as a local law amending the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring reports on preschool special education and early intervention services, as proposed in introduction number 1406-A for the year 2019, takes effect, except that section 3 of this local law takes effect January 1, 2022. \fs18\par
